title: [Large-Scale] Short-Intensive Course on Math Education Design Using Online Qualitative Research Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic research methodology comprehension and qualitative research case experience in mathematics education settings
context.additional_context: A course for in-service teachers aiming to apply qualitative research methods in math education. It requires TPACK framework-based integration of technological, pedagogical, and content knowledge. The focus is on analyzing math problem-solving processes, considering instructional contexts, and deriving educational implications during research design.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more theoretical concepts (research design, data interpretation, result generalization) through qualitative research case analyses related to mathematics education in LMS-based discussion boards.

Learners can design qualitative research proposals applicable to mathematics education settings according to the TPACK framework, including research problem definitions, sampling strategies, and data collection methods (observation/interviews).
Learners can complete draft research proposals incorporating peer evaluations and feedback using online collaboration tools, and present research validity reviews and improvement plans.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
